alert.note: Alert for Goshen (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 23 at 7:22PM MDT until June 23 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN GOSHEN AND EAST CENTRAL PLATTE COUNTIES... At 720 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Jay Em, or 16 miles southeast of Lusk, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...This storm has produced golf-ball sized hail stones near Fort Laramie, WY. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Lingle, Fort Laramie, Veteran, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Slater and Hwy 85 At Dry Rawhide Creek. TIME...MOT...LOC 0120Z 209DEG 101KT 4255 10432 THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
